text: Kenneth Meade Lakin (January 14, 1941 - November 24, 2014) was a U.S. physicist credited as the inventor of the solidly mounted resonator (SMR). == Biography == He was born in Grand Rapids, Michigan. He died at home in Redmond, Oregon, on November 24, 2012, from prostate cancer. == See also == * Thin-film bulk acoustic resonator == References == == Further reading == == External links == Category:1941 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American physicists Category:People from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:People from Redmond, Oregon Category:Stanford University alumni
title: Kenneth Meade Lakin
